column3:
Level 1:
Basic Basic awareness and foundational knowledge. Requires close supervision and detailed guidance.
column4:
Level 2:
Intermediate Working knowledge and consistent application. Needs periodic supervision and support for complex tasks.
column5:
Level 3:
Advanced Comprehensive understanding and independent application. Can handle most complex situations and guide others.
column6:
Level 4:
Expert Complete mastery, innovation, and leadership. Sets standards, develops new approaches, and mentors others.

column1: Functional Skills: technical or job-related skills that are necessary to perform tasks within a particular role
column3:
Understands and applies basic organizational practices; uses sales tools with guidance and maintains simple pipeline tracking.
Keeps basic sales records organized and uses tools with support to track leads and activities.
column4:
Manages a structured pipeline independently, maintains accurate data in sales tools, and tracks key performance metrics consistently.
Independently manages pipeline and metrics accurately using standard sales tools and processes.
column5:
Optimizes pipeline efficiency through strong organization, detailed analysis, and advanced tool utilization to drive data-informed decisions.
 Enhances sales outcomes by leveraging tools, data accuracy, and organization to optimize pipeline performance.
column6:
Sets best practices for pipeline and metrics management, mentors others in tool proficiency, and drives process improvements through data insights.
Leads pipeline excellence by defining best practices, maximizing tool efficiency, and enabling data-driven sales performance.

column3:
Demonstrates a positive attitude and basic communication skills when engaging new prospects; beginning to build confidence in relationship initiation.
Builds initial rapport with prospects using clear communication and a friendly approach with guidance.
column4:
Establishes trust and connection with prospects independently, adapting communication style to different personalities and needs.
Effectively engages and builds trust with diverse prospects through active listening and tailored communication.
column5:
Develops strong, lasting relationships with prospects by anticipating needs, handling objections skillfully, and creating mutual value.
Builds high-quality relationships that convert prospects into long-term partners through insight and influence.
column6:
Serves as a trusted advisor, leveraging deep relationship-building expertise to open strategic opportunities and mentor others in prospect engagement.
Leads relationship-building excellence, turning complex prospect interactions into lasting strategic partnerships.

column1:
Practices: 
specific methods, techniques, or processes to achieve specific goals
column3:
Grasps fundamental technical concepts with guidance and applies basic tools under supervision.
Understands and uses basic technical concepts and tools with support.
column4:
Independently learns and applies relevant technical concepts and tools to complete routine tasks.
Quickly applies technical knowledge to solve common problems with minimal assistance.
column5:
Adapts complex technical concepts to new situations and leverages tools to optimize job performance.
Effectively adapts and applies technical tools and concepts to enhance outcomes in varied contexts.
column6:
Masters and innovates with technical concepts and tools, mentors others, and leads adaptation of technology to drive business results.
Leads technical innovation and knowledge sharing, driving advanced application and adaptation of tools.

column3:
Recognizes straightforward problems and applies predefined solutions with guidance; beginning to develop analytical and decision-making skills.
Identifies simple issues and applies standard solutions with support and direction.
column4:
Independently analyzes common challenges, evaluates options, and selects practical solutions that meet short-term objectives.
Effectively resolves routine problems using logical analysis and sound decision-making.
column5:
Tackles complex or ambiguous problems through structured analysis and creative thinking, implementing sustainable, well-reasoned solutions.
Solves complex challenges with insight and creativity, consistently delivering effective outcomes.
column6:
Anticipates and prevents potential issues, drives strategic problem-solving across teams, and mentors others in critical thinking and decision-making excellence.
Leads strategic problem-solving, guiding others in innovative, data-driven decision-making and solution design.

column1: Team Work: interpersonal or soft skills to work effectively with others in a collaborative environment
column3:
Can communicate basic value points clearly, often relying on prepared scripts or templates.
Conveys fundamental value propositions clearly using standard messaging with guidance.
column4:
Independently tailors value propositions to different audiences, communicating benefits effectively both verbally and in writing.
Clearly articulates tailored value propositions to engage and persuade diverse prospects.
column5:
Persuasively delivers complex value propositions, addressing objections and highlighting unique benefits to influence decisions.
Crafts compelling, nuanced value propositions that resonate and convince even skeptical audiences.
column6:
Develops and mentors others on value articulation strategies, consistently creating innovative messaging that drives competitive advantage.
Leads value proposition excellence by innovating messaging and coaching teams to communicate persuasively at all levels.

column1: Business Impact: skills that influence on the overall success and strategic direction of the organization
column3:
Listens to feedback but may need encouragement to apply it consistently.
Receives feedback with openness but requires guidance to implement improvements.
column4:
Actively seeks feedback and makes noticeable adjustments to improve performance.
Welcomes constructive feedback and applies it to enhance work quality independently.
column5:
Regularly integrates feedback to drive significant personal growth and encourages others to do the same.
 Proactively adapts behavior based on feedback and models continuous improvement.
column6:
Champions a culture of feedback and development, mentoring others on how to embrace and use feedback effectively.
Leads by example in embracing feedback and fostering ongoing improvement across the team.

column3:
Shows willingness to complete assigned tasks and stays motivated with occasional encouragement.
Demonstrates basic enthusiasm and follows through on tasks with some prompting.
column4:
Consistently pursues goals with determination, overcomes routine obstacles, and takes initiative within their role.
Shows steady drive and proactively addresses challenges to meet objectives.
column5:
Maintains high energy and persistence during complex challenges, actively seeks ways to exceed role expectations.
Exhibits strong internal motivation and consistently goes beyond to achieve and contribute.
column6:
Inspires others through exceptional passion and resilience, leading efforts that push team and organizational success.
Drives and energizes teams with unwavering enthusiasm and a relentless focus on goals.

column3: Shows initial interest in learning but requires prompts to seek out new knowledge or skills.
column4: Actively pursues learning opportunities and applies new knowledge to improve performance.
column5: Consistently drives personal development and supports team learning through knowledge sharing.
column6:
Champions a culture of continuous learning, mentors others, and leads initiatives for professional growth.
Leads by example in lifelong learning and inspires growth across the organization.
